page.title: 07ST.KENELM'S CHURCH.
page.content: The Church of{St.Kenelm}is built of freestone rubble and is roofed with modern tiles. Much of the building dates from{1200,}although the present spire replaces the one blown down in the{17th Century.}The Church occupies a prominent position adjacent to the main road through the village and provides an interesting subject for the artist or photographer. The {Rector,}who is also responsible for the churches at{Harpley}and the {Shelsleys,}lives in the new{Rectory adjacent to the church. A{survey}of nearly ninety per cent of households in the village showed that 18% attended the Parish Church weekly,14% monthly, 42% rarely, and 26% never.
